abstract: Unseasoned investigators from the Securities and Exchange Commission were alternately intimidated and enthralled by a name-dropping, yarn-spinning Bernard L. Madoff as he dodged questions about his business, according to a scathing new report on the agency’s failure.

lead_paragraph: Unseasoned investigators from the Securities and Exchange Commission were alternately intimidated and enthralled by a name-dropping, yarn-spinning Bernard L. Madoff as he dodged questions about his financial house of cards, according to a scathing new report on the agency’s repeated failure to uncover the huge investment fraud, The New York Times’s David Stout writes.

headline.main: Report Details How Madoff’s Web Ensnared S.E.C.
